40. In sum, all figures should be realized
according to a person’s strength and spirit,
as well as actions, as is well understood:
for a fighter will exert himself differently
in pose and movement, more fiercely,
than a Philosopher, who in his gestures
appears to be disputing profound matters;
one must do one’s beset to distinguish them.
Differences between actions, according to the natures and circumstances of the people.

41. This man must appear, with one finger on another finger,
to be diligently making his argument clear.
Now there are many things which need no less
Art to depict well, such as a singer,
Or the difference between laughing and crying,
Frightened, melancholy, proud, and regretful,
But these and similar subjects
You will find in expressions of the Passions.

ab.b:
On the Composition and Invention of Histories.
The Fifth Chapter.

div.ab:
1. All things exist in a right and proper
arrangement or composition:
God’s creatures above and below,
kingdoms, countries, free states,
households, and various practices
which ingenious people bring into being;
one also sees ordering among dumb animals,
such as useful bees and industrious ants.
right-middleArrangement is necessary in everything; it is also practiced among the animals.

2. For painters, too, composition is
indispensable, for here is where the excellence
and power of the arts lie, bound together,
along with perfection, spirit, intelligence
and understanding, attentiveness, experience in all things;
therefore there are so few people gifted in
composition who are competent,
that we hear them praised for surpassing others in fame.

3. In that case, O picture-makers,
let us turn our attention to Composition
in our principal composition,
whether outdoors, in a house or a room,
right-middleDrawing on colored paper is very beneficial to highlights and darkening.
